intro: Cynoglossum dumanii, commonly known as the Persian hogweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of large, heart-shaped leaves and tall, sparsely branched stems that bear clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant is part of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its hairy stems and showy flowers. Cynoglossum dumanii typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
